question.body: Why is it important to know the location of a specific receptor?

multiple_choice.choice: It is important because it tells what type of hormone will be produced.
It is important because it provides information about how the hormone will affect the cell.
It is important because it tells exactly what hormone it will bind.
It is not important because all receptors will work the same way.

response.feedback: Incorrect. The receptor is located on the target cell not the hormone producing cell; a receptor is what a hormone binds to.
Correct. By knowing if the receptor is membrane bound or internal certain predictions about the mechanism of its action can be made.
Incorrect. The structure of the receptor will determine what hormone it binds.
Incorrect. Knowing where the receptor is located can allow predictions about its mechanism to be made.
